content.question: A music group expects to sell a new compact disc (CD) at the rate <math> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>000</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mn>0.12</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> CDs per week, where t denotes the number of weeks since the CD was first released. To the nearest thousand, how many CDs are expected to be sold during the first 12 weeks after the release?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts
